intro: Centaurea armena, commonly known as Armenian knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Centaurea armena is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
